en.label: Exandrian Calendar (Critical Role)
en.description: The calendar system used in Critical Role's world of Exandria, featuring unique month names and festival days. Created by Matthew Mercer for his campaign world.

months.name: Horisal
months.description: The month of renewal. The shortest month, marking the transition from winter to spring when the days begin to lengthen.

months.name: Misuthar
months.description: The month of new growth. Early spring brings the first stirrings of life as nature awakens from winter's slumber.

months.name: Dualahei
months.description: The month of flourishing. Mid-spring sees plants and flowers coming into full bloom across the lands.

months.name: Thunsheer
months.description: The month of storms. Late spring brings powerful weather patterns as the seasons shift toward summer.

months.name: Unndilar
months.description: The month of balance. The shortest regular month, representing the brief equilibrium between spring and summer.

months.name: Brussendar
months.description: The month of plenty. Early summer brings abundance as crops grow and the land reaches peak fertility.

months.name: Sydenstar
months.description: The month of high sun. The longest month of the year, marking the peak of summer when daylight reaches its maximum.

months.name: Fessuran
months.description: The month of harvest joy. Late summer brings the first harvests and celebrations of the year's bounty.

months.name: Quen'pillar
months.description: The month of reflection. The shortest month, marking the transition from summer to autumn in contemplative stillness.

months.name: Cuersaar
months.description: The month of gathering. Early autumn sees communities preparing for winter through harvest and stockpiling.

months.name: Duscar
months.description: The month of endings. The final month of the year, longest of autumn, when nature prepares for winter's return.

weekdays.name: Miresen
weekdays.description: First day of the week, traditionally a day for new beginnings and planning

weekdays.name: Grissen
weekdays.description: Second day of the week, often devoted to community gatherings and shared work

weekdays.name: Whelsen
weekdays.description: Third day of the week, a common day for travel and exploration

weekdays.name: Conthsen
weekdays.description: Fourth day of the week, traditionally devoted to craft and trade

weekdays.name: Folsen
weekdays.description: Fifth day of the week, often used for learning and study

weekdays.name: Yulisen
weekdays.description: Sixth day of the week, a day for worship and spiritual reflection

weekdays.name: Da'leysen
weekdays.description: Seventh day of the week, traditionally a day of rest and family time
